Setting the Responsibility Field

StarTeam tasks have a Responsibility field that shows the name of the user responsible for performing the task, while Microsoft Project assigns one or more resources to a task.

When a task is exported from Microsoft Project to StarTeam, one of the following occurs:

  • If only one resource has been assigned in Microsoft Project, the name of that user is entered in the Responsibility field.

  • If more than one resource has been assigned in Microsoft Project, the name of the first user is entered in the Responsibility field. (Due to the order in which resources are listed in Microsoft Project, this user is the one with the lowest User ID.)

When tasks are synchronized, the Responsibility field is ignored, so that changes made to this field from StarTeam are not overwritten.
